Incidents.Location: Bullards Bar Dam and Marysville Rd, 3 miles east of Dobbins
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
The fire burned in steep rocky conditions in the North Yuba drainage.

Marysville Road is now open, as well as Bullards Bar Recreation Areas and Campgrounds.

CAL FIRE is in Unified Command with US Forest Service NorCal Team 2.

Incidents.Name: Monte Fire
Incidents.Location: North side of El Monte Road, east of the community of Lakeside
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
The spread of the fire has been stopped. Improved mapping updates the acreage to 1,047 acres.

The Incident Commander is beginning to release some of the firefighting aircraft.

CAL FIRE is in unified command with the Cleveland National Forest, but a USFS Management Team will take over at 9 p.m.

El Monte Park was evacuated for precautionary reasons; there is still no threat to structures.10 people have been evacuated by Sheriff’s helicopters - 8 residents and 2 hikers.
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Monte Fire was in August 2010 at the North side of El Monte Road, east of the community of Lakeside in San Diego County.
Incidents.SearchKeywords: Monte Fire, San Diego County, 2010 fires, El Monte Road, Lakeside
Incidents.AdminUnit: CAL FIRE San Diego Unit / Cleveland National Forest

Incidents.Name: Late July Lightning Fires
Incidents.Location: Across northeast California
Incidents.ConditionStatement:
Since Saturday July 24, there have 5,000 lightning strikes across northeast California. As a result 194 confirmed fires have sparked in CAL FIRE's jurisdiction and on federal lands.

Major Lightning Fires:
Constania Complex – Lassen County
Mono Fire – Mono County
Modoc Lightning Complex – Modoc County
Incidents.SearchDescription: The Late July Lightning Fires was in July, across northeast California in multiple counties.

ListIncidents.Name: Late July Lightning Fires
ListIncidents.Location: Across northeast California
ListIncidents.ConditionStatement:
Since Saturday July 24, there have 5,000 lightning strikes across northeast California. As a result 194 confirmed fires have sparked in CAL FIRE's jurisdiction and on federal lands.

Major Lightning Fires:
Constania Complex – Lassen County
Mono Fire – Mono County
Modoc Lightning Complex – Modoc County
ListIncidents.SearchDescription: The Late July Lightning Fires was in July, across northeast California in multiple counties.
ListIncidents.SearchKeywords: Late July Lightning Fires, multiple counties, 2010 fires, northeast California

ListIncidents.Name: Monte Fire
ListIncidents.Location: North side of El Monte Road, east of the community of Lakeside
ListIncidents.ConditionStatement:
The spread of the fire has been stopped. Improved mapping updates the acreage to 1,047 acres.

The Incident Commander is beginning to release some of the firefighting aircraft.

CAL FIRE is in unified command with the Cleveland National Forest, but a USFS Management Team will take over at 9 p.m.

El Monte Park was evacuated for precautionary reasons; there is still no threat to structures.10 people have been evacuated by Sheriff’s helicopters - 8 residents and 2 hikers.
ListIncidents.SearchDescription: The Monte Fire was in August 2010 at the North side of El Monte Road, east of the community of Lakeside in San Diego County.
ListIncidents.SearchKeywords: Monte Fire, San Diego County, 2010 fires, El Monte Road, Lakeside
ListIncidents.AdminUnit: CAL FIRE San Diego Unit / Cleveland National Forest
